before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqpqh","text":"We first performed voltammetry recordings in ex vivo mouse brain slices following the steps detailed in Protocol: Fast-scan cyclic voltammetry to assess dopamine release in ex vivo mouse brain slices. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":95}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F9C451317E014502931BECF8DB41423D","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.36wgqdbmxvk5/v1"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e7oi8","text":"The steps detailed in this protocol are to label choline acetyltransferase (ChAT) or tyrosine hydroxylase (TH), which are known markers for cholinergic interneurons (Chl) and dopaminergic neurons and striatal axons (DA), respectively. We use an immunofluorescent approach in 300-µm thick slices of mouse brain tissue after performing ex vivo voltammetry recordings.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":334,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ip6o","text":"All procedures on animals were conducted in accordance with the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (United Kingdom), approved by an Animal Welfare and Ethical Review Board at the University of Oxford, under the authority of Licenses from the Home Office (UK).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

parent_collections.title: Zhang, Y. et al (2025) - An axonal brake on striatal dopamine output  by cholinergic interneurons

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5dhbb","text":"Fix slices in 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) dissolved in PBS containing 0.2% picric acid.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8qrkh","text":"Leave to fixate overnight at 4°C and then store in PBS. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dbl0f","text":"Wash x5 in PBS for 5 min. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59a3d","text":"Add primary antibody goat anti-ChAT (Millipore, 1:100) or goat anti-ChAT (1:200, AMCA) to the above mix.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1d2ee","text":"Prepare PBS containing0.5% Triton X-100, 1% Normal Goat Serum and 1% Foetal Bovine Serum. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28lci","text":"Add secondary antibody DyLight 594 Goat anti-Rabbit (1:1000) or CoraLite488 Goat anti-Rabbit (1:1000) antibody to the above mix.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mmvp","text":"Once done, remove all the PBS from the last wash and add the Secondary Antibody Solution. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"in0i","text":"Leave to incubate overnight (goat anti-ChAT from Millipore) or for five days (goat anti-ChAT from AMCA) at 4º C on an orbital shaker.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"20gqe","text":"Secondary Antibody:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ekmg6","text":"Acquire images using a 20×/0.75 NA objective in Zeiss LSM880 confocal microscope system running ZEN black version 2.3 (Zeiss), or a confocal microscope system (FV1000 IX81; Olympus) and Fluoview software (Olympus). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djcqh","text":"Maximum intensity projection from a z-stack of height 30 µm was captured individually and the stack of the pictures were compressed.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etpf1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"898fs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2cih","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6sf99","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9o72n","text":"Red fluorescence (TH and ChAT) was captured at 638–759 nm with 633 nm excitation. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":19,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"21jtg","text":"Green fluorescence (GCaMP, ChR2, and ASAP3) was captured at 493–630 nm with 488 nm excitation.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4t2e9","text":"This section details steps to label cholinergic interneurons (Chl) expressing channelrhodopsin-2 (ChR2) fused in-frame with eYFP.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":129}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6no80","text":"Prepare preincubation solution containing PBS with 10% Normal Donkey Serum and 0.5% Triton-X  during the last wash.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83ps6","text":"Leave to preincubate at room temperature for 1 h on an orbital shaker.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eotfl","text":"Once done, remove all the preincubation solution and add the Primary Antibody Solution. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ukdk","text":"This section details steps to label dopaminergic neurons and striatal axons (DA) expressing (i) channelrhodopsin-2 (ChR2) fused in-frame with eYFP; (ii) genetically encoded calcium indicator GCaMP6f; (iii) voltage sensor ASAP3 without a soma-targeting signal; or (iv) optogenetic actuator Chrimson.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":298}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3m91o","text":"Add primary antibody rabbit anti-TH (1:2000) to the above mix in the desired concentration.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4g4a6","text":"Leave to incubate overnight at 4º C on an orbital shaker.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7dd04","text":"Wash x5 with PBS for 5 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"98f1s","text":"Primary Antibody:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b23hl","text":"Wash x5 with PBS for 5 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8u9ol","text":"Secondary Antibody:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lf4o","text":"Prepare 3% Normal Donkey Serum and 0.5% Triton-X during the preincubation period.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ckcgh","text":"Prepare PBS containing 0.5% Triton X-100 and 3% Normal Donkey Serum. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4i6t4","text":"Add secondary antibody Alexa Fluor 568 donkey anti-goat (1:1000) to the above mix.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bvf6c","text":"Once done, remove all the PBS from the last wash and add the Secondary Antibody Solution. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7k14j","text":"Leave to incubate for 2h at room temperature on an orbital shaker.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"am","text":"Primary Antibody:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cim4o","text":"Prepare 1% Normal Goat Serum, 1% Fetal Bovine Serum and 0.5% Triton-X during the preincubation period.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"srdg","text":"Leave to incubate for 2h at room temperature on an orbital shaker.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7igai","text":"Wash x5 with PBS for 5 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"752gv","text":"Mount the individual slices on gelled slides with Vectashield mounting medium (Vector Labs).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Immunocytochemistry of acute brain slices used in ex vivo voltammetry recordings
